answerText: Alexei Favorskii[10] This strong base may provide a hydroxyl group in the Favorskii rearrangement. Putting it in solution with hydrochloric acid produces table salt, and it's useful for cleaning things.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | 1. Chicago A - MIT B | 16 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: When his namesake reaction is acid-catalyzed, it is called the MeyerÂ–Schuster rearrangement. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this chemist who also names a rearrangement which contracts the rings of cyclopropanones and creates carboxylic acids.
